title: Inclusive Social Studies Lesson Design for Students with Intellectual Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Need for personalized interaction reinforcement considering individual learning pace and cognitive levels; restructuring social studies content into applicable real-life forms

learning_goals: Students can explain three or more roles of community members using multiple means of representation based on Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles
Students can draft inclusive social problem-solving projects collaboratively with peers using digital collaboration tools.
Students can accurately reproduce learned content with over 80% accuracy by combining visual aids (images/videos) with text summaries.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
